clinical_study.brief_title: Observational Study of Baska Mask, a New Supraglottic Airway Device in Children
clinical_study.official_title: Observational Study of Baska Mask, a New Supraglottic Airway Device in Children

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators wish to accumulate initial data on the performance and safety of the Baska mask in paediatric patient population.

primary_outcome.time_frame: within 30 minutes of induction of general anesthesia
within 10 minutes of successful device placement
primary_outcome.description: the airway l;eak pressure is defined as the plateau airway pressure measured while the patient is apnoeic with the APL valve of the anaesthetic machine set to 35 cm H2O and the fresh gas flow set to 6 L/min

secondary_outcome.description: the tidal volumes will be measured in different head positions and the leak fractions calculated.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 30 minutes of induction of general anesthesia
secondary_outcome.description: the ease of device placement will be evaluated by Visual Analogue Scale

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from the start of device insertion untill discharge from recovery, an expected average of 2 hours
secondary_outcome.description: complications that may be related to the device use will be monitored including but not limited to desaturation episodes, laryngospasm, loss of airway, need to switch ot alternative device, blood staining on mask removal sore throat, dysphonia, dysphagia

clinical_study.condition: Baska Mask Efficacy and Safety in Children

intervention.intervention_name: Placement and use of Baska mask
intervention.description: Use of Baska mask as a supraglottic airway during general anesthesia

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- consent
- BMI 15-35
- weight over 30kg or age 8-16 yrs
- non-urgent surgery of planned duration up to 2 hrs
Exclusion Criteria:
- neck pathology
- previous or anticipated problems with the upper GI or upper airway
- increased risk of gastric aspiration
- expected difficult airway

responsible_party.investigator_title: Professor of Anaesthesia and Critical Care
